title: Email UNIVESP no Thunderbird
content:
Boa noite, pessoal! Sou aluno da Universidade Virtual do Estado de São Paulo (UNIVESP) e eles usam o Microsoft 365 como plataforma para o serviço de email deles.

Quando entro no Outlook.com e digito meu endereço de email da univesp (formato 9999999@aluno.univesp.br), sou redirecionado para a página da Univesp para preencher novamente meu login e senha e após esse processo, volto à pagina do Outlook e uso meu email normalmente.

Entretanto, nunca fui fã de serviços de webmail e gostaria de utilizar o Thunderbird para ler meus emails e me comunicar com os professores da universidade.

Tentei fazer a configuração do cliente usando os seguintes parâmetros:

Recebimento: servidor: imap-mail.outlook.com (IMAP); Porta 993, Segurança SSL/TLS, Método: Senha normal, e preenchi o nome de usuário com meu email univesp;

Envio: Servidor: smtp-mail.outlook.com; Porta 587; Segurança STARTTLS; Método: Senha normal, e preenchi o nome de usuário com meu email univesp.

O programa apresenta o seguinte erro: "Não foi possível acessar a conta no servidor. A configuração, o nome de usuário ou a senha provavelmente estão errados.

Alguém conhece uma solução para o que eu gostaria de fazer?

Em tempo, já perguntei no suporte da universidade, mas não obtive nenhuma resposta, como de praxe.

Desde já, obrigado!
creator: edsonp1976

title: Missing ability to search beyond the current date.
content:
Lightning had the ability to search the entire calendar for an event, sadly, this new iteration of the calendar built into Thunderbird 128.0.1esr doesn't support anything but today or later events.

Most of the time I use the calendar to search for a previous event (when I was previously somewhere). This is very important and an oversight on the part of who thought the search from now until the end of time was all anyone would need.

Can the functionality be returned to search every event and not just from today onward?

title: Email shown as sent in app did not actually get sent
content:
Hi there,

Yesterday I sent an email, only to find out today that it has not actually gone through. I did not receive any warning and have found it in Thunderbird's "sent" folder on my PC, yet looking for it in my browser did not yield any results and Outlook mobile, for instance, saved it as a draft before sending it. In neither could the email be found as "sent".

How does this happen? The email address in question is from an .edu-domain and as far as I'm concerned the settings to connect are the same as they are in Outlook - which did not have this problem.

Thanks in advance.

title: Trying to circumvent Windows path limit (260 chars) -> Maildir's emails name semantics
content:
Hi

I'm trying to circumvent the Windows path limit (260 chars), when using Maildir as storage for emails in Thunderbird (for IMAP-configured accounts).

The default path in Windows looks like:

C:\Users\user\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\jesvjtr1.default-release\ImapMail\xxxxxxxx.yyyyyyyyyyyy.com.pl\

which "consumes" 115 chars from 260 available (ok, I can edit profiles.ini, switch "IsRelative" to 0, and move the profile to C:\TB\user\jesvjtr1.default-release" for example, but this is inconvenient as I have to do for each user)

So I'm looking for other way - to make .eml filenames shorter - the current ones looks like: 00b201dac2f4%243f963bb0%24bec2b310%24@pw-xxxxxx.yyy.eml 00cd0e17-2810-4fa0-be24-aa612ae7aae2@victory-zzzzz.aa.eml

But You can ask why? Some of our users has complex folders tree, for example: Inbox -> Obecni KLIENCI -> ABCDEFGHI abcd xyz -> ABCDEFGHI abcd xyz France - Paris -> 2024 -> Oferty -> Zaakceptowane -> Dostarczone

The folders looks like: INBOX.sbd\Obecni KLIENCI.sbd\ABCDEFGHI abcd xyz.sbd\ABCDEFGHI abcd xyz France - Paris.sbd\2024.sbd\Oferty.sbd\Zaakceptowane.sbd\

(it all takes 242 chars)

then there will be "cur" and "tmp" folders inside the last one Zaakceptowane.sbd\cur Zaakceptowane.sbd\tmp

and when You want to store new email in the last folder (using filter), Thunderbird copied new email to tmp folder (using nstmp-xxx name), then move to cur with new name (00b201dac2f4%243f963bb0%24bec2b310%24@pw-xxxxxx.yyy.eml for example) and due to 260 chars limit it doesn't happened.

Emails are stuck in tmp with temporary names and when filter trying to do its thing again, the new nstmp-xxx files are created in tmp and so on - till the free space in disk are exhausted)

So I'm looking for settings that will make the names of .eml files shorter.

I'm curious, why Mozilla doesn't support long path names in Windows (using UNC paths "\\?\" and updating manifest file with these lines) <application xmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:asm.v3"> 

   <windowsSettings xmlns:ws2="http://schemas.microsoft.com/SMI/2016/WindowsSettings">        <ws2:longPathAware>true</ws2:longPathAware>    </windowsSettings>

</application>
creator: KG-STL

title: Thunderbird nem nyitja meg a levelek nagy r;sz;t
content:
Üdv!

Tud valaki segíteni, vagy találkozott hasonló hibával valaki? A Thunderbird pár napja nem nyit meg elég sok levelet, pop3 fiók van beállíítva, a thunderbird tárolómappa mérete elég nagy, 2019 óta vannak levelek benne Többnyire a réggebi levelek megnyithatóak de az elmúlt 1-2 év nem, mai nap is jött több levél, de volt köztük olyan ami nem nyitható meg, nincs semmi hibaüzenet egyszerüen a feladó tárgy érkezés ideje ... látható rákattintva a betekintésnél üres, dupla kattal új fülön megnyitva semmi nem látszik

Előre is köszönöm Szilágyi László
creator: szilagyilaszlo

title: Server timeout on email send
content:
I have an issue with Thunderbird on my PC sending any email of any size larger than a few lines. I can send small test emails with a few lines (<1KB) however any email with attachment or forwarding an email results in a : Sending failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.themessagingco.com.au timed out.

I have tried all combinations of outgoing server settings as recommended by my provider Mail server settings including swapping Security and port but no luck. Please note I can send and receive without issue on my iphones with the same server settings. Currently using port 587, Normal password authentication and STARTTLS.

I found some posts suggesting turning off outgoing email scanning on antivirus - no luck. I have turned off firewalls - no luck. I have tried no authentication (security = none) - no luck.

Thunderbird version is 128.1.0esr (32 bit). Using Norton 360 Antivirus

Strange that I can send small emails but nothing of any use Any ideas ???
creator: lncroos
